notes.text:
An update for libX11 is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The libX11 packages contain the core X11 protocol client library.

Security Fix(es):

* libX11: integer overflow leads to double free in locale handling (CVE-2020-14363)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: An integer overflow vulnerability leading to a double-free was found in libX11. This flaw allows a local privileged attacker to cause an application compiled with libX11 to crash, or in some cases, result in arbitrary code execution. The highest threat from this flaw is to confidentiality, integrity as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libX11: integer overflow leads to double free in locale handling
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Xorg server does not run with root privileges in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8. Therefore this flaw has been rated as having a moderate impact for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: libX11: integer overflow leads to double free in locale handling
